snippet: Leaks have been the bane of politicians from George Washington to Richard Nixon, who commissioned the White House plumbers to stanch them. But few leaks ever have presented a greater    sub rosa    threat than the one just weathered by California'...
lead_paragraph: Leaks have been the bane of politicians from George Washington to Richard Nixon, who commissioned the White House plumbers to stanch them. But few leaks ever have presented a greater sub rosa threat than the one just weathered by California's new Governor, Pete Wilson. For five years, this state has been in the grip of a drought so severe that its innumerable inhabitants have had to accept strict limitations on water usage, on pain of severe penalties. Even San Francisco's Mayor, Art Agnos, was soaked $13.91 in February fines and $9.50 for January because his family drained off about 90 gallons a day more than its allotment.
